result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca A Teschler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rebecca A Teschler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rebecca A Teschler was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete high school education.  Maintain employment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  No association or contact, directly or indirectly,  with either male, B.W. and R. E.,  currently in life.  Comply with psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Attend five self-help meetings per week for the first year of probation.  Provide proof of attendance to agent weekly.  Follow through with all conditions to retain custody of children.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.
